oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE FORCE AND STABILITY OF ARMOR UNITS FOR COMPOSITE BREAKWATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kimura, Katsutoshi
Mizuno, Yuzo
Hayashi, Michifumi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave force
armor
armor stability
breakwater
composite breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The stability of armor units for composite breakwaters was studied by two- and three-dimensional model tests and prototype failure analyses. The wave force on armor blocks was cleared for different relative mound depths and berm widths. The stable weight of armor blocks is proposed in which the block shape factor is used as a parameter. The necessary thickness of foot-protection blocks is formulated as a function of the relative mound depth for the breakwater trunk and head.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
